sub_topic: Calculation of reaction quotient for a chemical reaction
message_1:
What is the reaction quotient for the following chemical reaction at 25°C, with concentrations of products and reactants as follows:

2NOBr(g) ⇌ 2NO(g) + Br2(g)

[NO]^2[Br2] / [NOBr]^2
message_2:
To calculate the reaction quotient (Q) for the given reaction, you need to know the concentrations of the products and reactants at a specific moment in time. The general formula for the reaction quotient is:

Q = [Products] / [Reactants]

For the given reaction:

2NOBr(g) ⇌ 2NO(g) + Br2(g)

Q = [NO]^2[Br2] / [NOBr]^2

Please provide the concentrations of NO, Br2, and NOBr at 25°C to calculate the reaction quotient.
